com.google.template.soy.exprtree

Class DataAccessNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.template.soy.basetree.AbstractNode
      • com.google.template.soy.exprtree.AbstractExprNode
        • com.google.template.soy.exprtree.AbstractParentExprNode
          • com.google.template.soy.exprtree.DataAccessNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Node, ParentNode<ExprNode>, ExprNode, ExprNode.ParentExprNode
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FieldAccessNode, ItemAccessNode

    public abstract class DataAccessNode
extends AbstractParentExprNode
    Base class which represents access to a field or element of an aggregate value, such as an object or collection. Syntactically, data accesses are always suffix operators such as base.fieldName or base[expression].

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.google.template.soy.exprtree.ExprNode

    • Field Detail

      • isNullSafe

        protected final boolean isNullSafe

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataAccessNode

        protected DataAccessNode(ExprNode base,
                         SourceLocation sourceLocation,
                         boolean isNullSafe)
        Parameters:
        base - The base expression, that is a reference to the object containing the named field.
        sourceLocation - The node's source location.
        isNullSafe - If true, checks during evaluation whether the base expression is null and returns null instead of causing an invalid dereference.

      • DataAccessNode

        protected DataAccessNode(DataAccessNode orig,
                         CopyState copyState)

    • Method Detail

      • getBaseExprChild

        public ExprNode getBaseExprChild()
        Returns the base expression from which we're looking up the named field.

      • isNullSafe

        public boolean isNullSafe()
        Returns whether this field reference is null-safe.

      • getSourceStringSuffix

        public abstract String getSourceStringSuffix()
        Returns the source string for the part of the expression that accesses the item - in other words, not including the base expression. This is intended for use in reporting errors.

      • toSourceString

        public String toSourceString()
        Description copied from interface: Node
        Builds a Soy source string that could be the source for this node. Note that this is not the actual original source string, but a (sort of) canonical equivalent. Note: Some nodes do not have a direct mapping to Soy source (such as nodes created during some optimization passes). Thus this method may not always be supported.
        Returns:
        A Soy string that could be the source for this node.
